title: Miguel González (Mexican boxer)
text:
Miguel González (born August 12, 1967 in <a href="Coatzacoalcos">Coatzacoalcos</a>, <a href="Veracruz">Veracruz</a>, <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a>) is a <a href="Mexican%20people">Mexican</a> professional <a href="Boxing">boxer</a> in the <a href="Welterweight">Welterweight</a> division.
Pro career.
In March 1991, he lost his first title shot to <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a> National <a href="Lightweight">Lightweight</a> champion Omar Flores.
Miguel almost upset two-time world champion <a href="Roger%20Mayweather">Roger Mayweather</a> in Hilton Hotel, Laughlin, Nevada.
On April 24, 1998 González lost to three-time world champion, <a href="United%20States">American</a> <a href="Antonio%20Margarito">Antonio Margarito</a> in Scottish Rite Center, San Diego, California, Nevada. He has also fought <a href="C%C3%A9sar%20Valdez%20Valenzuela">César Valdez Valenzuela</a>, and two-time world champion <a href="Daniel%20Santos%20%28boxer%29">Daniel Santos</a>.
